frontmatter.title: Latest Updates!
frontmatter.description: It's been awhile since you guys have heard from me. Some of you may be wondering what happened to me?

frontmatter.title: Happy Thanksgiving
frontmatter.description: We can give thanks to God in all times in life. God deserves all our praise

frontmatter.title: Gifts of the Holy Spirit
frontmatter.description: Did you know that when you accept the free gift of salvation that you receive the Holy Spirit. It is the goal of the Holy Spirit to transform you to become like Jesus through a process that is called sanctification. Let's look at one way the Holy Spirit does this. Which, is through spiritual gifts

frontmatter.title: God opposes the proud
frontmatter.description: Before I talk about the mercy of God. Let's look at the definition of mercy. I did a search online and this is what I found. 'Compassion or forgiveness shown toward someone whom it is within one's power to punish or harm.'

frontmatter.title: God's mercy endures forever
frontmatter.description: Before I talk about the mercy of God. Let's look at the definition of mercy. I did a search online and this is what I found. 'Compassion or forgiveness shown toward someone whom it is within one's power to punish or harm.'

verses.overrideVerse: [16] “For God so loved the world, that he gave his only Son, that whoever believes in him should not perish but have eternal life. (ESV)
[27] And you also will bear witness, because you have been with me from the beginning. (ESV)
[35] Jesus said to them, “I am the bread of life; whoever comes to me shall not hunger, and whoever believes in me shall never thirst. (ESV)
[12] Again Jesus spoke to them, saying, “I am the light of the world. Whoever follows me will not walk in darkness, but will have the light of life.” (ESV)
[7] So Jesus again said to them, “Truly, truly, I say to you, I am the door of the sheep. (ESV)

[11] I am the good shepherd. The good shepherd lays down his life for the sheep. [12] He who is a hired hand and not a shepherd, who does not own the sheep, sees the wolf coming and leaves the sheep and flees, and the wolf snatches them and scatters them. [13] He flees because he is a hired hand and cares nothing for the sheep. [14] I am the good shepherd. I know my own and my own know me, (ESV)
[25] Jesus said to her, “I am the resurrection and the life. Whoever believes in me, though he die, yet shall he live, (ESV)
[6] Jesus said to him, “I am the way, and the truth, and the life. No one comes to the Father except through me. (ESV)
[11] These things I have spoken to you, that my joy may be in you, and that your joy may be full. (ESV)

[13] Jesus said to her, “Everyone who drinks of this water will be thirsty again, [14] but whoever drinks of the water that I will give him will never be thirsty again. The water that I will give him will become in him a spring of water welling up to eternal life.” (ESV)
[13] Greater love has no one than this, that someone lay down his life for his friends. (ESV)

It is the goal of the Holy Spirit to transform you to become like Jesus through a process that is called sanctification. Let's look at one way the Holy Spirit does this. Which, is through spiritual gifts

frontmatter.title: Blessings from the Cross
frontmatter.description: The work of the Cross was so significant and we reap so many benefits thanks to Jesus Christ. I take a look at some of those blessings in my lastest devotional.

frontmatter.title: Assurance you are saved
frontmatter.description: It is the work of the enemey to confuse us and make us think we are not saved. Remember that you can never lose your salvation. 1 John is a great essential doctrine passage that shows us we can be assured of our salvation.

frontmatter.title: How God transforms your life through salvation
frontmatter.description: Being saved is the greatest moment if your life. It's when you are declared righteous before a Holy God. How great is that!! Ever wonder what happens to your life after making that great decision.
